meanings.definition: A short, vertical, swollen underground plant stem that serves as a storage organ
meanings.sent1: The corm stores food for the plant underground.
meanings.sent2: The gardener planted the corm in the soil to grow a new flower.
meanings.sent3: The corm decided to hide all the snacks for itself underground.
meanings.sent4: The corm was like a treasure chest full of nutrients for the plant.
meanings.sent5: The corm looked like a small potato, but it was full of plant energy.

meanings.definition: A rounded, fleshy base of a plant from which roots and shoots emerge
meanings.sent1: The corm at the base of the plant was round and juicy.
meanings.sent2: New shoots sprouted from the corm, reaching towards the sun.
meanings.sent3: The corm felt proud as it supported the growing plant above.
meanings.sent4: The corm was the heart of the plant, giving life to all its parts.
meanings.sent5: The corm was like a magic seed, bringing life to the whole plant.
